<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Defines the object file and target independent interfaces used by the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="comment">/// assembler backend to write native file format object files.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The object writer contains a few callbacks used by the assembler to allow</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the object writer to modify the assembler data structures at appropriate</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment">/// points. Once assembly is complete, the object writer is given the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment">/// MCAssembler instance, which contains all the symbol and section data which</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="comment">/// should be emitted as part of writeObject().</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
